maintenance_h.help1Txt1b: provides several different maintenance functions, for use in various situations.
maintenance_h.presetTxt1a: The Restart button should be used to perform a correct restart of the
maintenance_h.presetTxt1b: if it is not behaving as expected. This will not affect any of the current settings.
maintenance_h.presetTxt2: Pressing the Restore button will return most settings to the factory default values, meaning that the unit must be reconfigured and any event types and PTZ presets must be recreated. The only settings saved are:
maintenance_h.help3Txt1a: The Restart button should be used to perform a correct restart of the
maintenance_h.help3Txt1b: if it is not behaving as expected. This will not affect any of the current settings.
maintenance_h.help3Txt2: Pressing the Restore button will return most settings to the factory default values, meaning that the unit must be reconfigured and any event types must be recreated. The only settings saved are:
maintenance_h.defaultTxt1: The Default button should be used with caution. Pressing this will return all settings to the factory default values, which also means that the IP address will need to be reset to make the unit accessible.
maintenance_h.defaultTxt2a: It is also possible to reset the
maintenance_h.defaultTxt2b: using the Control button located in the product casing. This has the same effect as the default button described here.
maintenance_h.twoContrButtons: using the Control button (button 1) located in the product casing. This has the same effect as the default button described here.
maintenance_h.help7bTxt: Click the Test button to check the PTZ's status.
maintenance_h.help7aTxt: Click the Test button to check the dome's status.
maintenance_h.calibrateTxt: The Calibrate button is used to reset the optics to the factory default position. This may be necessary in situations where the optics has lost its calibration during transport or has been exposed to extreme vibrations. Focus and Zoom will also be reset to default positions and need to be reconfigured. Go to Video & Audio > Focus & Zoom.
maintenance_h.calOpticZoomTxt: The Calibrate button is used to reset the optics. This may be necessary in situations where the optics has lost its calibration during transport or has been exposed to extreme vibrations.
maintenance_h.calOpticZoom2Txt: The optics will go back to latest known position when the Optical zoom for installation mode has been selected. The optics will go to max wide and infinity position when the Optical zoom for monitoring mode has been selected.
maintenance_h.help7Txt1a: From time to time, Axis releases new firmware for the
maintenance_h.help7Txt1b: . These new releases can contain improved functionality, bug fixes and occasionally, completely new features.
maintenance_h.help9Txt: Always running the latest release is recommended practice. The latest firmware release can be obtained from the Axis support web at www.axis.com/techsup/
maintenance_h.help10Txt1a: To upgrade the firmware for the
maintenance_h.help10Txt1b: , click the Browse button to find the firmware file and then click the Upgrade button. For more information, please see the release notes supplied with the firmware.
maintenance_h.blinkLEDTxt: To help identify the physical channel of the IP address for maintenance purposes, a LED can be set to flash. Enter the number and choose the unit of time from the drop-down list. The LED can be set to flash for a number of seconds, minutes or even hours. Click Flash LED to initiate flashing.
maintenance_h.blinkLEDcamTxt: To help identify the Axis product, the Status LED can be set to flash. The LED can be set to flash for a number of seconds, minutes or hours. Click Flash LED to initiate flashing.
maintenance_h.rackOverTxt: Click Rack Overview to see a graphical representation and other information of where the blade is situated in the rack.
maintenance_h.help12Txt: To take a backup of all of the parameters
maintenance_h.help54Txt1b: , click the Backup button. You will then be asked to specify a name for the backup file and a location to save it in.
maintenance_h.help14Txt: As there is no limit to the number of backup files that can be saved, it is possible to, for example, take a backup every time major changes are made. Naming files according to the date they were created will also assist in quickly finding the correct backup file.
maintenance_h.help16Txt1a: Should it become necessary to return the
maintenance_h.help16Txt1b:
to a previous configuration, click the Browse button to locate the saved backup file and then click the Restore button.
Note - It is not possible to restore the unit from a backup file that was created in a previous firmware version.

rackOverview_h.introTxt: Rack overview can show where the blade is located in the Axis video rack. Depending on the rack the encoder blade is placed in information will show automatically here and the fields cannot be edited. Otherwise, in those cases where no information is given, click Edit. Additional information appears about video, status, phantom power and audio.
rackOverview_h.editTxt1: Click Edit to enter a description of the rack, encoder blade and its location.
rackOverview_h.editTxt2: Description - Enter a name or description of the rack.
rackOverview_h.editTxt3: Rack ID - Enter an ID for your rack.
rackOverview_h.editTxt4: Rack model - Enter the model of your rack, for example AXIS 291 1U.
rackOverview_h.editTxt5: Slot number - Select the slot number where the encoder blade is placed.
